title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: What is the LCD (largest common denominator) of $$\frac{1}{2}$$, $$\frac{3}{4}$$, and $$\frac{-2}{3}$$?

title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: We must now multiply both sides of the equation by the LCD. We get: $$12\times7=\frac{12\times1}{2} x+\frac{12\times3}{4} x-\frac{12\times2}{3} x$$. This simplifies to $$7x=84$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: To solve this equation, we must now isolate the "x" term.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: To isolate x, we must divide both sides of the equation by 7. What is the value of x?
